venue.name: Salomon Center for Teaching - Brown University

item.description:
This lecture will be on the Brown University Campus  - Salomom Center, Room 101 (De Ciccio Family Auditorium - Link to Map:

http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=SALOMON#building/SALOMON

Some of you astronomy aficionados will be aware of the recent *confirmation* of the existence of the Higgs Boson particle. The Brown Physics Department is giving a talk ("Discovery of a Higgs Boson?") about how the particle was found, as well as it's importance.

We can meet at Paragon at 600PM (234 Thayer St, Providence, RI) - Tuesday night at Paragon has a "3-way Tuesday", with a 4th app free:

http://paragonandviva.com/?page_id=14

The talk starts at 700PM. Those interested can walk down with me around 645PM.

http://events.brown.edu/events/cal/CAL-00149399-399c1cce-0139-9c5badc1-0000079eevents@brown.edu/

And if there is any interest afterwards, we can head back to Paragon, or move somewhere else.
item.how_to_find_us: Raghav is hositng, please look at his picture!
item.name: Lecture: Dark Matter, Dark Energy, God Particle?!
